ASK_OBJECT:
{
  "QUESTIONS": [
    {
      "Q": "What specific color saturation ranges should be applied to the windmill and bicycle to maintain Van Gogh’s impasto intensity while contrasting with the soft pastel gradients of the Ghibli-inspired sky?",
      "DIMENSION": "COLOR_TONALITY",
      "WHY": "Ensures the earthly objects retain emotional warmth and texture while balancing against the celestial softness.",
      "PRIORITY": 1,
      "ANSWER_FORMAT": "saturation range (e.g., 60-90% for windmill; 40-70% for bicycle)",
      "DEPENDENCIES": ["warm, vibrant hues with high saturation", "soft, diffused tones with gentle transitions"]
    },
    {
      "Q": "How should the flowing lines connecting the windmill and bicycle to the swirling stars be structured in terms of curve density (e.g., 4–6 per 10 cm) and directionality (e.g., serpentine, looping), and what texture should they exhibit (e.g., impasto, soft blend) to maintain organic continuity?",
      "DIMENSION": "FORM_COMPOSITION",
      "WHY": "Clarifies how movement and visual connection are established between the three elements in a unified narrative.",
      "PRIORITY": 2,
      "ANSWER_FORMAT": "curve density (e.g., 4–6 per 10 cm), directionality (e.g., serpentine), texture (e.g., impasto or soft blend)",
      "DEPENDENCIES": ["serpentine curves with 4–6 curves per 10 cm", "flowing, fluid lines that suggest motion and continuity"]
    },
    {
      "Q": "What percentage of the composition should be occupied by the swirling stars, and how should the windmill and bicycle be positioned (e.g., lower third, mid-ground) relative to the stars to maintain a grounded celestial journey?",
      "DIMENSION": "COMPOSITIONAL_DEVICES",
      "WHY": "Establishes spatial hierarchy and emotional balance between earthly presence and cosmic wonder.",
      "PRIORITY": 3,
      "ANSWER_FORMAT": "percentage (e.g., 60%), positioning (e.g., windmill at lower third, bicycle mid-ground)",
      "DEPENDENCIES": ["60% stars in background", "windmill at lower third, bicycle in mid-ground"]
    }
  ],
  "COUNT": 3,
  "NEGATIVE_CHECKS": [
    "Should the windmill or bicycle appear disconnected from the swirling stars or lack visible connection lines to break narrative continuity?",
    "Could the windmill or bicycle be rendered in flat, non-impasto tones, undermining the Van Gogh-inspired emotional texture?",
    "Is the starry background too dominant (over 70%) or too sparse (under 40%), disrupting the emotional balance between earth and sky?"
  ],
  "FOLLOWUP_TRIGGERS": [
    "IF COLOR_TONALITY specifies saturation below 50% for windmill or bicycle THEN ask for specific color combinations that preserve emotional warmth",
    "IF FORM_COMPOSITION indicates serpentine lines with less than 4 curves per 10 cm THEN ask for curvature radius and line thickness range",
    "IF COMPOSITIONAL_DEVICES shows stars over 70% THEN ask how the windmill and bicycle are visually anchored to prevent floating or disconnection"
  ]
}
